Title:
Six new species of Tomentella (Thelephorales, Basidiomycota)
from tropical Pine forests in central Vietnam
Keywords:
phylogenetic analyses; resupinate thelephoroid fungi;
taxonomy; tropical mixed forest
Abstract:
Up to this point, studies on the taxonomy and phylogeny of
the basidiomycete genus Tomentella stemmed mainly from the temperate to
boreal zones of the Northern hemisphere, but were scarce in tropical
Asia. In this study, six new species from central Vietnam in Southeast
Asia, T. bidoupensis, T. brevisterigmata, T. cinereobrunnea, T.
longiechinula, T. stipitobasidia and T. verruculata, are described and
illustrated based on morphological characteristics and molecular
phylogenetic analyses of the nuclear ribosomal ITS (internal transcribed
spacer: ITS1-5.8S-ITS2) and LSU (large sub-unit: 28S) markers. Maximum
likelihood and Bayesian analyses were used to confirm the phylogenetic
posi-tions of these new species and all of them can be well recognized
by the macroscopical and ana-tomical characteristics. The new species
and closely related species in the phylogenetic tree, and the new
species and morphologically similar species are discussed, and the host
plant for these new species have been speculating based on the
phylogenetic analysis and the tree species information of the
investigated forests.
